summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a Bureau of Prisons Lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Facility (MCC) in New York, conducted on August 14, 2019. The interview focuses on the standard operating procedures for inmate counts and rounds at the MCC, as well as the Lieutenant's lack of direct knowledge regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.

persons.name: EMPLOYEE 2
persons.context: A BOP Lieutenant at the Metropolitan Correctional Facility (MCC) interviewed about her duties, the count and rounds procedures, and her lack of knowledge regarding the Epstein death investigation.

persons.name: THOMAS
persons.context: A guard at the MCC whom EMPLOYEE 2 stated she did not speak with about the events surrounding Epstein's death.

persons.name: NOEL
persons.context: A guard at the MCC whom EMPLOYEE 2 stated she did not speak with about the events surrounding Epstein's death.

connections.description: EMPLOYEE 2, a Lieutenant, is a supervisor of guards like THOMAS at the MCC, but she stated she did not speak with him about Epstein's death.
EMPLOYEE 2, a Lieutenant, is a supervisor of guards like NOEL at the MCC, but she stated she did not speak with him about Epstein's death.

events.title: Interview of BOP Lieutenant
events.description: FBI and OIG agents, along with AUSAs, interviewed BOP Lieutenant EMPLOYEE 2 regarding prison procedures and the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The interview context is the investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC. The Lieutenant is asked about procedures and communication with guards.

keyFacts: The interview reveals standard BOP procedures for inmate counts and rounds at the MCC, including a two-guard verification process and 30-40 minute rounds.
BOP Lieutenant EMPLOYEE 2 stated she had no knowledge of counts or rounds not being conducted and that no one would inform her if that happened.
EMPLOYEE 2 made comments about MCC staffing limitations, noting 'guards can only do so much with what they are given' and 'due to staffing sometimes things happen.'
EMPLOYEE 2 explicitly stated she did not speak with guards THOMAS and NOEL about the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The document is part of the post-mortem investigation into the circumstances of Jeffrey Epstein's death while in federal custody.
